explanation:
code_hardening: Initialized the return value to the provided defaultValue, added a null check for the key, and consistently fall back to the default on any reflection failure. Used final parameters/locals where appropriate.
resolve_compilation_errors: Updated the method signature to include the defaultValue parameter and adjusted the reflective lookup to the two-argument android.os.SystemProperties.get(String, String) overload. Used fully qualified class names to avoid missing imports.
exception_handling: Preserved rethrowing IllegalArgumentException exactly as before, and modified the generic catch to return the provided defaultValue instead of an empty string.
logic_customization: Changed the logic so the reflected call passes both key and defaultValue, ensuring missing system properties return the caller-supplied default and only yield an empty string if the default itself is empty.
refactoring: Changed visibility to private to make the method internal, clarified parameter naming (key vs defaultValue), removed redundant String object creation, and invoked the static method with a null target.
misc: Updated behavior comments implicitly via clearer structure and ensured compatibility whether or not a Context is available; no new custom API calls beyond android.os.SystemProperties.get(String, String).
